job_description: IT Service Management Co-op Student (2 Positions)Eight month – one year term commencing May 2015Are we a right match for you?At the Calgary Airport Authority, not only will you get to be a part of developing one of Canada’s busiest airports, you will also receive competitive wages, growth through learning and development, and numerous opportunities to connect with students just like you! It is also a great opportunity to learn more about the many elements of operating a major international airport, in the midst of a $2 billion expansion. With the recent opening of Canada’s longest runway and the construction of a new international terminal, this is an exciting time to be a part of the YYC Crew.What will you be doing?Like many organizations, the Calgary International Airport is going through changes at every level. We must plan, implement and deliver these changes appropriately to move the business forward. Working with the IT&T department, you will provide real-world skills, techniques and proven strategies for planning, managing risk, and increasing stability on IT service delivery . Situated in our Information Technology and Telecommunications department, you will support business processes dealing with change requests.What will your primary responsibilities be? Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure process are followed and documentation is complete prior to submission Maintain and publish the change schedule Ensure proper documentation is completed for release of changes from testing Ensuring communication plans are published for IT changes and support the delivery of business process training Collaborate with Help Desk personnel to identify trending incidents Gather and analyze information relevant to change requests Identify problems and collaborate with responsible parties to develop solutions Provide support in the development of accurate management reports Documenting release process using online application
job_requirements: What will you bring to this role? Academic background in Business, Management or a focus on Computer Science, Management Information Systems or Information Technology Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Ability to ensure high quality results and attention to detail Excellent time management and interpersonal skills Able to prepare, analyze, and present statistical data Highly enthusiastic individual that has the ability to take initiative and work effectively and efficiently individually Strong organizational skills as well as excellent written and verbal communication Knowledge of or familiarity with ITIL is considered an assetNote: Students must be enrolled in a Co-op Program at an accredited post-secondary institution.Open To All Majors:No
